channel.title: ColorPicking~SDcit
channel.description:
[CENTER]Yes, another color picking Tutorial [/CENTER]
NOTE: [b] This tutorial starts at the point in which you have gotten scar [/b]
Introduction: In this tutorial we will cover:
1. How to pick colors 2. How to put colors into a setup
[CENTER][b]What are colors [/b] [/CENTER]
Colors you see are what Scar detects things as. Each color on the computer has its very own code like 0=black. Scar uses this color to find objects
[CENTER][b]How to get a color [/b] [/CENTER]
To get a color, you must use something called a color picker which shall be later described
[CENTER][b]Getting a color [/b] [/CENTER]
1. [IMG]http://img187.imageshack.us/img187/8364/toolbar6sj.png[/img]
The above image is the tool bar that should be in scar.
[IMG]http://img368.imageshack.us/img368/941/colorpicker1sg.png[/img]
That is the legendary color picker, one of the basics of all scripts. *Orchestral music plays*
2. To find a color, you must click the color picker. To do so, you move your mouse over to the button, then take your left hand, place it over your right pointer finger, and push down.
After doing so, the whole screen should freeze except the mouse.
3. You should see your mouse has magically transformed into crosshairs with a quote like tag protruding from it. Move that over to the color on the item you wish to pick. For example, if the script said [code] Pick the color of a essence in your inv [/code]
Then you'd move the crosshairs/mouse over to the essence and click.
[IMG]http://img513.imageshack.us/img513/8952/essence9vi.png[/img]
4. A set of #'s like
Color Picked: 16777215 at (498, 309)
should appear in the debug box as shown in the picture below
[IMG]http://img513.imageshack.us/img513/6427/debug8vt.png[/img]
THat is the Debug box.
Drag your mouse over the 16777215 (that is the color, in this example) and hit ctrl+c.
5. [center][b]Setting up[/b][/center]
There are 2 types of setups, one in the const and one as a procedure
[center][b]const setting[/b][/center] [code] const [/code]
Under that their should be things like [code] const rockcolor=123213;//color of the rock [/code]
or something. Highlight whatever is after the = sign and hit ctrl+v. The color of the object should be put their.
[center][b]Procedure setup[/b][/center]
Some scripts require the colors to be put in a procedure like [code] procedure setup; begin rockcolor:=123213//color of the rock end; [/code]
or something. Highlight whatever is after the := sign and hit ctrl+v. The color of the object should be put their.
[center][b]Common terms used in color picking[/b][/center] [b]Here are some common terms used in color picking that I have seen. If you notice others just tell me[/b]
MM- Minimap
[b][size=5]STARTLING BREAKTHROUGH[/b]
I figured out that when a color is picked, it is automatically set to the copy. So all you have to do is go to the number in the const. Highlight it and hit ctrl+v
CREDITS
SDcit: I stole this tut from him!!1!!1!
[b]P.S. If it fits the mods/admins. This use to be in the tutorial section. Can someone move it?

item.title: ColorPicking~SDcit
item.dc:creator: @sdcit sdcit
item.description:
@sdcit wrote:

[CENTER]Yes, another color picking Tutorial [/CENTER]

NOTE: This tutorial starts at the point in which you have gotten scar

Introduction: In this tutorial we will cover:

  1. How to pick colors
  2. How to put colors into a setup

[CENTER]What are colors [/CENTER]

Colors you see are what Scar detects things as. Each color on the computer has its very own code like 0=black. Scar uses this color to find objects

[CENTER]How to get a color [/CENTER]

To get a color, you must use something called a color picker which shall be later described

[CENTER]Getting a color [/CENTER]

The above image is the tool bar that should be in scar.

That is the legendary color picker, one of the basics of all scripts. Orchestral music plays

  1. To find a color, you must click the color picker. To do so, you move your mouse over to the button, then take your left hand, place it over your right pointer finger, and push down.

After doing so, the whole screen should freeze except the mouse.

  1. You should see your mouse has magically transformed into crosshairs with a quote like tag protruding from it. Move that over to the color on the item you wish to pick. For example, if the script said
Pick the color of a essence in your inv

Then you’d move the crosshairs/mouse over to the essence and click.

  1. A set of #'s like

Color Picked: 16777215 at (498, 309)

should appear in the debug box as shown in the picture below

THat is the Debug box.

Drag your mouse over the 16777215 (that is the color, in this example) and hit
ctrl+c.

  1. [center]Setting up[/center]

There are 2 types of setups, one in the const and one as a procedure

[center]const setting[/center]

const

Under that their should be things like

const
rockcolor=123213;//color of the rock

or something. Highlight whatever is after the = sign and hit ctrl+v. The color of the object should be put their.

[center]Procedure setup[/center]

Some scripts require the colors to be put in a procedure like

procedure setup;
begin
rockcolor:=123213//color of the rock
end;

or something. Highlight whatever is after the := sign and hit ctrl+v. The color of the object should be put their.

[center]Common terms used in color picking[/center]
Here are some common terms used in color picking that I have seen. If you notice others just tell me

MM- Minimap

[size=5]STARTLING BREAKTHROUGH

I figured out that when a color is picked, it is automatically set to the copy. So all you have to do is go to the number in the const. Highlight it and hit ctrl+v

CREDITS

SDcit: I stole this tut from him!!1!!1!

[b]P.S. If it fits the mods/admins. This use to be in the tutorial section. Can someone move it?
